Pourrais-tu me dire si c'est normal d'avoir autant de version diff√©rente de cela :

D'apr√®s l'image que vous avez partag√©e, il semble que vous ayez de nombreuses versions diff√©rentes des Redistribuables Visual C++ de Microsoft install√©es sur votre syst√®me. C'est en fait assez courant sur les syst√®mes Windows, car diff√©rentes applications que vous installez peuvent d√©pendre de diff√©rentes versions des Redistribuables Visual C++.

Voici quelques points pour mieux comprendre cette situation :

- **Compatibilit√© des Applications** : Chaque application ou jeu qui a √©t√© d√©velopp√© avec une certaine version du Redistribuable Visual C++ a besoin de cette version sp√©cifique pour fonctionner correctement. C'est pourquoi plusieurs versions peuvent coexister sur le m√™me syst√®me.

- **Versions x86 et x64** : Vous avez des versions 32 bits (x86) et 64 bits (x64) des redistribuables. M√™me sur un syst√®me 64 bits, les versions 32 bits sont n√©cessaires pour les applications qui ne sont pas compil√©es pour une architecture 64 bits.

- **Mises √† Jour S√©curit√© et Fonctionnalit√©** : Microsoft publie des mises √† jour pour ces redistribuables pour am√©liorer la s√©curit√© et la fonctionnalit√©. Certaines applications peuvent n√©cessiter des mises √† jour sp√©cifiques pour fonctionner.

- **Consommation d'Espace Disque** : Bien qu'il puisse sembler qu'il y a beaucoup de ces redistribuables, ils ne prennent g√©n√©ralement pas beaucoup de place sur le disque dur (comme vous pouvez le voir, la plupart sont relativement petits en taille).

Cela √©tant dit, vous ne devriez pas essayer de d√©sinstaller ces redistribuables manuellement sauf si vous √™tes absolument certain qu'aucune application que vous utilisez ne d√©pend de la version que vous envisagez de supprimer. Leur suppression pourrait entra√Æner des dysfonctionnements des applications qui en d√©pendent.

Si vous souhaitez vraiment v√©rifier et nettoyer les versions qui pourraient ne pas √™tre n√©cessaires, cela devrait √™tre fait avec prudence. Vous pourriez envisager d'utiliser un outil tel que "Microsoft Program Install and Uninstall Troubleshooter", qui peut vous aider √† r√©soudre les probl√®mes li√©s √† l'installation ou la d√©sinstallation des programmes, mais il est con√ßu principalement pour r√©soudre les erreurs et n'est pas sp√©cifiquement un outil de nettoyage. 

En g√©n√©ral, il est s√©curitaire de laisser ces redistribuables sur votre syst√®me. Si l'espace disque est une pr√©occupation majeure, il serait probablement plus efficace de chercher d'autres fichiers ou programmes qui prennent beaucoup de place et qui ne sont plus n√©cessaires.
Ok merci et pour :

L'image que vous avez envoy√©e montre trois installations de Microsoft 365 Apps, toutes dans la langue fran√ßaise (fr-fr), mais avec des noms l√©g√®rement diff√©rents : une pour les entreprises, une autre sans pr√©cision, et une troisi√®me pour les entreprises √† nouveau. Chaque installation prend environ 3,8 Go d'espace.

Voici quelques clarifications :

- **Installations Multiples** : Normalement, une seule installation de Microsoft 365 Apps est n√©cessaire pour un utilisateur. Il est possible que ces entr√©es soient des doublons ou des installations r√©siduelles de tentatives de mise √† jour ou de changement de licence.

- **Microsoft 365 Apps for business vs. enterprise** : Ces deux peuvent √™tre des versions diff√©rentes de la suite Office, destin√©es √† des tailles d'entreprises diff√©rentes avec des ensembles de fonctionnalit√©s peut-√™tre diff√©rents. Toutefois, il est inhabituel d'avoir les deux install√©es sur une m√™me machine, √† moins qu'il n'y ait eu des changements dans les licences ou les abonnements.

- **Espace Disque** : √âtant donn√© que chacune prend 3,8 Go, cela pourrait √™tre un signe que les installations sont dupliqu√©es ou que des mises √† jour ont cr√©√© des installations s√©par√©es sans supprimer les anciennes versions.

Avant de prendre des mesures pour lib√©rer de l'espace, voici ce que je recommande :

1. **V√©rifier les Abonnements** : Regardez dans les param√®tres de compte de Microsoft Office pour voir quel abonnement est actif et si ces installations correspondent √† des abonnements diff√©rents.

2. **Utiliser les Outils Microsoft** : Microsoft propose des outils pour r√©parer les installations d'Office, qui peuvent parfois r√©soudre les probl√®mes de doublons ou d'installations corrompues.

3. **D√©sinstallation S√©lective** : Si vous √™tes s√ªr qu'une installation est superflue, utilisez le "Panneau de configuration" > "Programmes et fonctionnalit√©s" pour d√©sinstaller la version inutile. Assurez-vous d'avoir les informations de connexion pour votre abonnement Microsoft 365 au cas o√π vous auriez besoin de r√©installer Office.

4. **Support Technique de Microsoft** : Si vous n'√™tes pas s√ªr de la proc√©dure √† suivre ou si vous avez des questions sur vos licences, contactez le support technique de Microsoft. Ils peuvent vous donner des instructions sp√©cifiques bas√©es sur les d√©tails de votre abonnement.

Faites attention avant de d√©sinstaller, car cela pourrait affecter votre capacit√© √† utiliser Office si vous supprimez la mauvaise version. Assurez-vous d'avoir sauvegard√© vos fichiers et de conna√Ætre vos informations de licence.

Pourrais-tu me trouver un lien pour t√©l√©charge rce dont tu me parles au point 2.
En effet j'avais plusieurs licences et du coup je suppose plusieurs version de Office.
Je souhaiterai vraiment compl√®tement nettoyer tout √ßa proprement et ne garder que mon compte Office actuel actif.
Mais autant supprimer les occurences de Office j'ai l'impression que cela est possible autant compl√®tement nettoyer l'ordinateur de toutes les traces des anciennes version et surtout des anciens comptes cela est compliqu√©.

Microsoft PC Manager is free to use, can blend in with the system theme, and has a lot of useful tools that won‚Äôt delete your system files. We don‚Äôt see any harm in using it, especially when ...
# „Äê19‚Ä†Download and install or reinstall Microsoft 365 or Office 2021 on a PC ...‚Ä†support.microsoft.com„Äë
From the Microsoft 365 home page select Install apps. Select Install (or depending on your version, Install apps> ). From the home page select Install apps (If you set a different start page, go to aka.ms/office-install .) For Microsoft 365 operated by 21 Vianet go to login.partner.microsoftonline.cn/account.

Vous pouvez utiliser l'outil "Microsoft Support and Recovery Assistant" pour d√©sinstaller compl√®tement les versions de Microsoft Office de votre ordinateur. Cela devrait √©galement vous aider √† supprimer les traces des anciennes installations et des comptes. Voici les √©tapes pour utiliser cet outil :

1. T√©l√©chargez l'outil automatis√© en vous rendant sur la page de support de Microsoft via ce lien : [Uninstall Office automatically - Microsoft Support](https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/uninstall-office-automatically-9ad57b43-fa12-859a-9cf0-b694637b3b05).

2. Une fois le fichier `SetupProd_OffScrub.exe` t√©l√©charg√©, ex√©cutez-le.

4. Suivez les instructions √† l'√©cran et, lorsque vous y √™tes invit√©, red√©marrez votre ordinateur.

5. Apr√®s le red√©marrage de votre ordinateur, l'outil de d√©sinstallation se rouvrira automatiquement pour terminer la derni√®re √©tape du processus de d√©sinstallation. Suivez les invites restantes.

Si vous avez besoin de r√©installer Office par la suite, vous pouvez choisir la version que vous souhaitez installer et suivre les instructions fournies par Microsoft. Assurez-vous de vous connecter avec le compte Microsoft actif que vous souhaitez conserver pour √©viter toute confusion avec les anciennes licences ou versions.

Outlook propose de passer de la version que j'utilise au New Outlook.
Version actuelle : Microsoft¬Æ Outlook¬Æ pour Microsoft¬†365 MSO (Version 2401 Build 16.0.17231.20194) 64 bits 
New Outlook : Microsoft Outlook Version 1.2024.131.300 (Production) - Client Version is 20240126002.14

Mais il me semble que cette nouvelle version, m√™me si s√©duisante, comporte pas mal de bug et de fonctionnalit√©s manquantes ou non-fonctionelles.

Pourrais-tu faire des recherches afin de savoir laquelle des 2 versions serait la plus adapt√©e pour mes coll√®gues et moi-m√™me.
Sachant que nous devons pouvoir facilement g√®rer plusieurs adresses emails, plusieurs agendas et pouvoir cr√©er des r√©unions dans Microsoft Teams de la mani√®re la plus facile.

Merci.

##### User Ratings & Reviews 

Reviews are generated by real users. When reviewing a product, users are asked to assess the product‚Äôs overall quality, which includes assigning specific ratings for ease of use, value for money, customer support, and functionality.

Pros/Cons

  * Pros

  * It‚Äôs the best professional level software for any office or school. Very reliable and super user friendly.

  * I grew up with this software, it was taught to me at school and I thought it was the only way to do things. I was in love with Microsoft 365, its useful, accessible and easy to use tools.

  * Cons

  * It is terrible on mobile or even if you just have the admin panel taking up half of your screen. Can be frustrating to work with.

  * If I have no internet connection then I an not able to access anything which can be frustrating if I am out somewhere with no connection.

„Äê7‚Ä†Read all user reviews„Äë

  * Pros

  * I can even add an image to my signature which is a very attractive feature. The customer care team were very responsive when I had a problem last year.

  * Easy to access the mail service and friendly support for customized subscriptions of the application. The scheduling option is quite good and mobile access of the mails is very useful at the times.

  * Cons

  * It is hard to transition from Gsuite to Microsoft outlook. Nothing is inherently wrong with Outlook, but it is different enough to be annoying.

  * It can look different depending on whether or not you're using it with the online web app or with the desktop application, so it can be confusing if you're not used to it.

# Outlook for Windows: The Future of Mail, Calendar, and People on Windows 11

New Outlook for Windows More...Less

The new Outlook for Windows brings the latest features with¬†a modern and simplified design to your Windows 11 PC. You can tailor it to your style and do more with the new Outlook for Windows!¬†Learn more about the new Outlook for Windows „Äê92‚Ä†here‚Ä†techcommunity.microsoft.com„Äë.

## When will the new Outlook for Windows replace the Mail, Calendar, and People apps?

Beginning in 2024, new Windows 11 devices will be shipped with the new Outlook for Windows as the default mailbox application free for all to use. The Mail and Calendar applications will continue to be available via download in the Microsoft Store through December 31, 2024. After this date the Mail & Calendar applications will no longer be supported. On existing devices, users can switch to the new Outlook for Windows from a toggle in the Mail and Calendar applications. You can see more information about¬†accessing the People app „Äê93‚Ä†here„Äë.¬†

## Move to the new Outlook for Windows

To try the preview of the new Outlook for Windows, you can slide the Try the new Outlook¬†toggle located in the upper-right corner of your Mail and Calendar or the classic Outlook for Windows applications, then follow the onscreen instructions.¬†See „Äê94‚Ä†Getting started with the new Outlook for Windows. „Äë

NOTE: You can switch back to your previous experience at any time. Just slide the toggle off and it will automatically open your previous version with no data or email loss.¬†¬†

## Why use the new Outlook for Windows

The new Outlook for Windows is for everyone. Now everyone with Windows gets the best of Outlook built into Windows for free. No subscription needed. You will write better emails with advanced AI built into the new Outlook for Windows to help you write impactful, clearer, mistake-free messages. New Outlook for Windows can also help remind you to follow up on important conversations. Other great features of the new Outlook for Windows include:

  * Streamline accounts. Now everyone can access their emails‚Äîin one spot‚Äîon every Windows device. That‚Äôs Gmail, Yahoo! and even a place for that account you use for shopping.

  * Stay on top of things. Organize your appointments, share availability and events with a click, and ensure time for important people and events.

  * Feel secure. Trust in Microsoft‚Äôs security to help keep your emails and documents safe from phishing and scams.

  * Accomplish more. Enjoy Microsoft 365 free on the web and use Word, Excel, PowerPoint and OneDrive with the click of a button.

  * Stay organized. File your valuable¬†content neatly or find it simply with universal search, make your calendar yours with multiple options and personalization capabilities, and know when your packages will arrive with package tracking.

  * Unify your accounts. The new Outlook for Windows brings several advantages¬†when it comes to managing your emails and calendars. For example, you can now view your various emails and calendar events in one place, making it easier to stay organized. This is also great for people who have accounts from multiple providers, as they can access them all from one unified inbox.¬†  
'

# Overview of the new Outlook for Windows

  * Article 
  * 11/15/2023
  * 1 contributor 

   Feedback

## In this article

The new Outlook for Windows is reimagined to be more agile, deliver faster feature deployment and availability, and provide a consistent experience in Windows.

New Outlook is currently offered as a preview for commercial accounts and is generally available for consumer accounts. For more user support information, see „Äê5‚Ä†Getting started with the new Outlook for Windows‚Ä†support.microsoft.com„Äë.

## Architecture

The new Outlook for Windows, built upon modern service architecture, is inspired by the Outlook web experience. It operates within a streamlined Native Windows Integration Component and utilizes WebView2. For more information, see „Äê6‚Ä†Microsoft Edge WebView2 and Microsoft 365 Apps„Äë.

## Packaging

The new Outlook for Windows is delivered as an MSIX package. Users acquire the package through the Outlook entry in the Microsoft Store app. For custom deployment by system administrators, the package is made available for manual or scripted installation. For more information, see „Äê7‚Ä†What is MSIX?„Äë

In addition to the MSIX packaging, setup.exe is also available. Setup.exe simplifies the deployment matrix since it contains a complete set of the required packages. In general, MSIX requires a separate package for each platform. As such, setup.exe is preferred for deployments. MSIX and Windows Package Manager (winget) options are provided because some tenants already have solutions that use these options. For more information, see „Äê8‚Ä†Deployment overview for the new Outlook for Windows„Äë.

## Windows integration

As highlighted earlier, new Outlook is a native application, based on WebView2. The experience is provided by Outlook on the web but is given access to local machine resources through the Native Windows Integration Component. With this approach, features and scenarios previously inaccessible to web apps can be implemented in the new Outlook for Windows. A few examples are rich notifications and more complete access to files and local resources.

Windows integration is managed by a small component that updates in the background. Updates are delivered approximately every week from the Office Content Delivery Network (CDN). In the past, such a fast update cadence would be challenging for large deployments due to the validation steps most enterprises undertake. This update cadence is less of a concern for new Outlook because almost none of the feature implementations are in this Windows integration component. It serves as a thin application only providing access to local machine resources.

Consistent with many service-based architectures, the client and service remain close in version. If updates can‚Äôt be applied for an extended period, users could see an error message that new Outlook isn't compatible with the current service. If this error occurs, users can close and reopen the application to apply the latest update.

Organizations used to distribute updates for classic Outlook from a custom local network location, but this practice is now obsolete and unnecessary due to the reduced package size.

## Feature delivery

New functionality is flighted to different release rings, as is the case for Microsoft 365 for the web. Some tenants or individual users in organizations could opt to get early access to features by enrolling in the Targeted release. Build updates don‚Äôt go through the same channels as the classic Outlook for Windows system, nor do they control new feature delivery. With service-delivered changes, features and fixes can be deployed faster and more reliably. With classic Outlook, customers were concerned with the cadence of deployment mostly because it took days or weeks to get available fixes. The new Outlook for Windows delivers critical updates within hours. For more information, see „Äê9‚Ä†Set up the Standard or Targeted release options„Äë.

For updates about features that are rolling out, refer to the „Äê10‚Ä†Microsoft 365 Roadmap‚Ä†aka.ms„Äë.

* * *

## Feedback

Was this page helpful?

Yes No

Pour d√©cider entre la version actuelle de Microsoft Outlook pour Microsoft 365 et la nouvelle version de Microsoft Outlook (New Outlook), il est important de consid√©rer plusieurs aspects, notamment les fonctionnalit√©s, la facilit√© d'utilisation, et la prise en charge des fonctionnalit√©s cl√©s pour votre √©quipe.

1. **Fonctionnalit√©s et Facilit√© d'Utilisation** : 
   - Les deux versions d'Outlook ont re√ßu des √©valuations positives des utilisateurs, avec Microsoft 365 obtenant une note l√©g√®rement plus √©lev√©e pour le soutien √† la client√®le par rapport √† Microsoft Outlook„Äê7‚Ä†source„Äë.
   - New Outlook pour Windows est con√ßu pour √™tre plus agile et offrir une exp√©rience plus homog√®ne sur Windows, inspir√© par l'exp√©rience d'Outlook sur le web„Äê10‚Ä†source„Äë.

2. **Gestion de Plusieurs Comptes et Agendas** :
   - New Outlook pour Windows permet de g√©rer facilement plusieurs comptes de messagerie et √©v√©nements de calendrier en un seul endroit, ce qui est pratique pour ceux qui ont des comptes de plusieurs fournisseurs„Äê9‚Ä†source„Äë.
   - La version actuelle d'Outlook pour PC supporte √©galement la connexion √† plusieurs comptes, y compris Exchange Server, Microsoft 365 Exchange Online, Outlook.com, Gmail.com, Yahoo!, et les comptes IMAP„Äê8‚Ä†source„Äë.

3. **Int√©gration avec Microsoft Teams pour Cr√©er des R√©unions** :
   - Bien que les d√©tails sp√©cifiques sur l'int√©gration de Teams avec les deux versions d'Outlook ne soient pas explicitement mentionn√©s dans les sources consult√©es, il est probable que les deux versions supportent la cr√©ation de r√©unions Teams, √©tant donn√© l'int√©gration √©troite entre les produits Microsoft.

4. **Prise en Charge des Fonctionnalit√©s Mobiles** :
   - Si l'acc√®s mobile est important, il est √† noter que certaines fonctionnalit√©s comme la liste des dossiers favoris, la vue/envoi de courriers √† partir de bo√Ætes aux lettres partag√©es, l'acc√®s aux dossiers publics, et certaines autres fonctionnalit√©s ne sont pas disponibles sur les applications mobiles d'Outlook„Äê8‚Ä†source„Äë.

5. **Transition et Support** :

D'autre part, si vous recherchez une interface plus moderne et une int√©gration am√©lior√©e avec Windows, New Outlook pourrait √™tre un meilleur choix. ##### User Ratings & Reviews 

Reviews are generated by real users. When reviewing a product, users are asked to assess the product‚Äôs overall quality, which includes assigning specific ratings for ease of use, value for money, customer support, and functionality.

Pros/Cons

  * Pros

  * It‚Äôs the best professional level software for any office or school. Very reliable and super user friendly.

  * I grew up with this software, it was taught to me at school and I thought it was the only way to do things. I was in love with Microsoft 365, its useful, accessible and easy to use tools.

  * Cons

  * It is terrible on mobile or even if you just have the admin panel taking up half of your screen. Can be frustrating to work with.

  * If I have no internet connection then I an not able to access anything which can be frustrating if I am out somewhere with no connection.

„Äê7‚Ä†Read all user reviews„Äë

  * Pros

  * I can even add an image to my signature which is a very attractive feature. The customer care team were very responsive when I had a problem last year.

  * Easy to access the mail service and friendly support for customized subscriptions of the application. The scheduling option is quite good and mobile access of the mails is very useful at the times.

  * Cons

  * It is hard to transition from Gsuite to Microsoft outlook. Nothing is inherently wrong with Outlook, but it is different enough to be annoying.

  * It can look different depending on whether or not you're using it with the online web app or with the desktop application, so it can be confusing if you're not used to it.

metadata.text:
Read in English Save „Äê4‚Ä† ‚Ä†github.com„Äë  

Table of contents   Read in English Save „Äê4‚Ä† Edit ‚Ä†github.com„Äë  Print

Twitter LinkedIn Facebook Email

Table of contents

# Overview of the new Outlook for Windows

  * Article 
  * 11/15/2023
  * 1 contributor 

   Feedback

## In this article

The new Outlook for Windows is reimagined to be more agile, deliver faster feature deployment and availability, and provide a consistent experience in Windows.

New Outlook is currently offered as a preview for commercial accounts and is generally available for consumer accounts. For more user support information, see „Äê5‚Ä†Getting started with the new Outlook for Windows‚Ä†support.microsoft.com„Äë.

## Architecture

The new Outlook for Windows, built upon modern service architecture, is inspired by the Outlook web experience. It operates within a streamlined Native Windows Integration Component and utilizes WebView2. For more information, see „Äê6‚Ä†Microsoft Edge WebView2 and Microsoft 365 Apps„Äë.

## Packaging

The new Outlook for Windows is delivered as an MSIX package. Users acquire the package through the Outlook entry in the Microsoft Store app. For custom deployment by system administrators, the package is made available for manual or scripted installation. For more information, see „Äê7‚Ä†What is MSIX?„Äë

In addition to the MSIX packaging, setup.exe is also available. Setup.exe simplifies the deployment matrix since it contains a complete set of the required packages. In general, MSIX requires a separate package for each platform. As such, setup.exe is preferred for deployments. MSIX and Windows Package Manager (winget) options are provided because some tenants already have solutions that use these options. For more information, see „Äê8‚Ä†Deployment overview for the new Outlook for Windows„Äë.

## Windows integration

As highlighted earlier, new Outlook is a native application, based on WebView2. The experience is provided by Outlook on the web but is given access to local machine resources through the Native Windows Integration Component. With this approach, features and scenarios previously inaccessible to web apps can be implemented in the new Outlook for Windows. A few examples are rich notifications and more complete access to files and local resources.

Windows integration is managed by a small component that updates in the background. Updates are delivered approximately every week from the Office Content Delivery Network (CDN). In the past, such a fast update cadence would be challenging for large deployments due to the validation steps most enterprises undertake. This update cadence is less of a concern for new Outlook because almost none of the feature implementations are in this Windows integration component. It serves as a thin application only providing access to local machine resources.

Consistent with many service-based architectures, the client and service remain close in version. If updates can‚Äôt be applied for an extended period, users could see an error message that new Outlook isn't compatible with the current service. If this error occurs, users can close and reopen the application to apply the latest update.

Organizations used to distribute updates for classic Outlook from a custom local network location, but this practice is now obsolete and unnecessary due to the reduced package size.

## Feature delivery

New functionality is flighted to different release rings, as is the case for Microsoft 365 for the web. Some tenants or individual users in organizations could opt to get early access to features by enrolling in the Targeted release. Build updates don‚Äôt go through the same channels as the classic Outlook for Windows system, nor do they control new feature delivery. With service-delivered changes, features and fixes can be deployed faster and more reliably. With classic Outlook, customers were concerned with the cadence of deployment mostly because it took days or weeks to get available fixes. The new Outlook for Windows delivers critical updates within hours. For more information, see „Äê9‚Ä†Set up the Standard or Targeted release options„Äë.

For updates about features that are rolling out, refer to the „Äê10‚Ä†Microsoft 365 Roadmap‚Ä†aka.ms„Äë.

* * *

# Outlook for Windows: The Future of Mail, Calendar, and People on Windows 11

New Outlook for Windows More...Less

The new Outlook for Windows brings the latest features with¬†a modern and simplified design to your Windows 11 PC. You can tailor it to your style and do more with the new Outlook for Windows!¬†Learn more about the new Outlook for Windows „Äê92‚Ä†here‚Ä†techcommunity.microsoft.com„Äë.

## When will the new Outlook for Windows replace the Mail, Calendar, and People apps?

Beginning in 2024, new Windows 11 devices will be shipped with the new Outlook for Windows as the default mailbox application free for all to use. The Mail and Calendar applications will continue to be available via download in the Microsoft Store through December 31, 2024. After this date the Mail & Calendar applications will no longer be supported. On existing devices, users can switch to the new Outlook for Windows from a toggle in the Mail and Calendar applications. You can see more information about¬†accessing the People app „Äê93‚Ä†here„Äë.¬†

## Move to the new Outlook for Windows

To try the preview of the new Outlook for Windows, you can slide the Try the new Outlook¬†toggle located in the upper-right corner of your Mail and Calendar or the classic Outlook for Windows applications, then follow the onscreen instructions.¬†See „Äê94‚Ä†Getting started with the new Outlook for Windows. „Äë

NOTE: You can switch back to your previous experience at any time. Just slide the toggle off and it will automatically open your previous version with no data or email loss.¬†¬†

## Why use the new Outlook for Windows

The new Outlook for Windows is for everyone. Now everyone with Windows gets the best of Outlook built into Windows for free. No subscription needed. You will write better emails with advanced AI built into the new Outlook for Windows to help you write impactful, clearer, mistake-free messages. New Outlook for Windows can also help remind you to follow up on important conversations. Other great features of the new Outlook for Windows include:

  * Streamline accounts. Now everyone can access their emails‚Äîin one spot‚Äîon every Windows device. That‚Äôs Gmail, Yahoo! and even a place for that account you use for shopping.

  * Stay on top of things. Organize your appointments, share availability and events with a click, and ensure time for important people and events.

  * Feel secure. Trust in Microsoft‚Äôs security to help keep your emails and documents safe from phishing and scams.

  * Accomplish more. Enjoy Microsoft 365 free on the web and use Word, Excel, PowerPoint and OneDrive with the click of a button.

  * Stay organized. File your valuable¬†content neatly or find it simply with universal search, make your calendar yours with multiple options and personalization capabilities, and know when your packages will arrive with package tracking.

  * Unify your accounts. The new Outlook for Windows brings several advantages¬†when it comes to managing your emails and calendars. For example, you can now view your various emails and calendar events in one place, making it easier to stay organized. This is also great for people who have accounts from multiple providers, as they can access them all from one unified inbox.¬†  
'

Comparisons

„Äê8‚Ä†Alternatives„Äë

Microsoft 365 has 13496 reviews and a rating of 4.65 / 5 stars vs Microsoft Outlook which has 1856 reviews and a rating of 4.52 / 5 stars. # Overview of the new Outlook for Windows

  * Article 
  * 11/15/2023
  * 1 contributor 

   Feedback

## In this article

The new Outlook for Windows is reimagined to be more agile, deliver faster feature deployment and availability, and provide a consistent experience in Windows.

New Outlook is currently offered as a preview for commercial accounts and is generally available for consumer accounts. For more user support information, see „Äê5‚Ä†Getting started with the new Outlook for Windows‚Ä†support.microsoft.com„Äë.

## Architecture

The new Outlook for Windows, built upon modern service architecture, is inspired by the Outlook web experience. It operates within a streamlined Native Windows Integration Component and utilizes WebView2. For more information, see „Äê6‚Ä†Microsoft Edge WebView2 and Microsoft 365 Apps„Äë.

## Packaging

The new Outlook for Windows is delivered as an MSIX package. Users acquire the package through the Outlook entry in the Microsoft Store app. For custom deployment by system administrators, the package is made available for manual or scripted installation. For more information, see „Äê7‚Ä†What is MSIX?„Äë

In addition to the MSIX packaging, setup.exe is also available. Setup.exe simplifies the deployment matrix since it contains a complete set of the required packages. In general, MSIX requires a separate package for each platform. As such, setup.exe is preferred for deployments. MSIX and Windows Package Manager (winget) options are provided because some tenants already have solutions that use these options. For more information, see „Äê8‚Ä†Deployment overview for the new Outlook for Windows„Äë.

## Windows integration

As highlighted earlier, new Outlook is a native application, based on WebView2. The experience is provided by Outlook on the web but is given access to local machine resources through the Native Windows Integration Component. With this approach, features and scenarios previously inaccessible to web apps can be implemented in the new Outlook for Windows. A few examples are rich notifications and more complete access to files and local resources.

Windows integration is managed by a small component that updates in the background. Updates are delivered approximately every week from the Office Content Delivery Network (CDN). In the past, such a fast update cadence would be challenging for large deployments due to the validation steps most enterprises undertake. This update cadence is less of a concern for new Outlook because almost none of the feature implementations are in this Windows integration component. It serves as a thin application only providing access to local machine resources.

Consistent with many service-based architectures, the client and service remain close in version. If updates can‚Äôt be applied for an extended period, users could see an error message that new Outlook isn't compatible with the current service. If this error occurs, users can close and reopen the application to apply the latest update.

Organizations used to distribute updates for classic Outlook from a custom local network location, but this practice is now obsolete and unnecessary due to the reduced package size.

## Feature delivery

New functionality is flighted to different release rings, as is the case for Microsoft 365 for the web. Some tenants or individual users in organizations could opt to get early access to features by enrolling in the Targeted release. Build updates don‚Äôt go through the same channels as the classic Outlook for Windows system, nor do they control new feature delivery. With service-delivered changes, features and fixes can be deployed faster and more reliably. With classic Outlook, customers were concerned with the cadence of deployment mostly because it took days or weeks to get available fixes. The new Outlook for Windows delivers critical updates within hours. For more information, see „Äê9‚Ä†Set up the Standard or Targeted release options„Äë.

For updates about features that are rolling out, refer to the „Äê10‚Ä†Microsoft 365 Roadmap‚Ä†aka.ms„Äë.

# Outlook for Windows: The Future of Mail, Calendar, and People on Windows 11

New Outlook for Windows More...Less

The new Outlook for Windows brings the latest features with¬†a modern and simplified design to your Windows 11 PC. You can tailor it to your style and do more with the new Outlook for Windows!¬†Learn more about the new Outlook for Windows „Äê92‚Ä†here‚Ä†techcommunity.microsoft.com„Äë.

## When will the new Outlook for Windows replace the Mail, Calendar, and People apps?

Beginning in 2024, new Windows 11 devices will be shipped with the new Outlook for Windows as the default mailbox application free for all to use. The Mail and Calendar applications will continue to be available via download in the Microsoft Store through December 31, 2024. After this date the Mail & Calendar applications will no longer be supported. On existing devices, users can switch to the new Outlook for Windows from a toggle in the Mail and Calendar applications. You can see more information about¬†accessing the People app „Äê93‚Ä†here„Äë.¬†

## Move to the new Outlook for Windows

To try the preview of the new Outlook for Windows, you can slide the Try the new Outlook¬†toggle located in the upper-right corner of your Mail and Calendar or the classic Outlook for Windows applications, then follow the onscreen instructions.¬†See „Äê94‚Ä†Getting started with the new Outlook for Windows. „Äë

NOTE: You can switch back to your previous experience at any time. Just slide the toggle off and it will automatically open your previous version with no data or email loss.¬†¬†

## Why use the new Outlook for Windows

The new Outlook for Windows is for everyone. Now everyone with Windows gets the best of Outlook built into Windows for free. No subscription needed. You will write better emails with advanced AI built into the new Outlook for Windows to help you write impactful, clearer, mistake-free messages. New Outlook for Windows can also help remind you to follow up on important conversations. Other great features of the new Outlook for Windows include:

  * Streamline accounts. Now everyone can access their emails‚Äîin one spot‚Äîon every Windows device. That‚Äôs Gmail, Yahoo! and even a place for that account you use for shopping.

  * Stay on top of things. Organize your appointments, share availability and events with a click, and ensure time for important people and events.

  * Feel secure. Trust in Microsoft‚Äôs security to help keep your emails and documents safe from phishing and scams.

  * Accomplish more. Enjoy Microsoft 365 free on the web and use Word, Excel, PowerPoint and OneDrive with the click of a button.

  * Stay organized. File your valuable¬†content neatly or find it simply with universal search, make your calendar yours with multiple options and personalization capabilities, and know when your packages will arrive with package tracking.

  * Unify your accounts. The new Outlook for Windows brings several advantages¬†when it comes to managing your emails and calendars. For example, you can now view your various emails and calendar events in one place, making it easier to stay organized. This is also great for people who have accounts from multiple providers, as they can access them all from one unified inbox.¬†

A propos de la tenue de la comptabilit√© d'une association et du calculs des bilan comptable.
Je vois qu'il est mention du standard XBRL, puis-je produire un fichier dans ce standard dans Excel ? Et si oui comment ?

Salut ! Parler de comptabilit√© et de XBRL, c'est tout un monde, n'est-ce pas ? Alors, XBRL (eXtensible Business Reporting Language) est un langage de balisage qui permet de communiquer des informations financi√®res de mani√®re standardis√©e. C'est super utile pour rendre la comptabilit√© et les rapports financiers plus accessibles et compr√©hensibles, surtout pour une association comme la tienne.

Pour ce qui est d'Excel, eh bien, tu es en terrain connu ici ! Tu peux effectivement cr√©er des fichiers XBRL √† partir d'Excel, mais il te faudra un petit coup de pouce. Excel en lui-m√™me ne supporte pas nativement le format XBRL, donc il te faudra utiliser un compl√©ment (add-in) ou un logiciel externe qui peut faire la conversion pour toi.

Voici les grandes lignes de comment tu pourrais proc√©der :

1. **Pr√©pare tes donn√©es dans Excel** : Comme d'habitude, organise tes √©tats financiers ou tes rapports comptables dans Excel.

2. **Utilise un compl√©ment ou un outil de conversion** : Il existe des outils qui peuvent se greffer √† Excel pour convertir tes donn√©es en XBRL. Ces outils te permettront de mapper tes donn√©es Excel avec les taxonomies XBRL, qui sont essentiellement des ensembles de r√®gles d√©finissant comment les informations financi√®res doivent √™tre pr√©sent√©es.

3. **Conversion et validation** : Une fois que tu as mapp√© tes donn√©es, l'outil de conversion peut g√©n√©rer un fichier XBRL. Il est important de valider ce fichier pour s'assurer qu'il respecte les normes XBRL et qu'il n'y a pas d'erreurs.

4. **Publication ou envoi** : Enfin, tu peux utiliser ce fichier XBRL pour le reporting ou pour le partager avec les parties prenantes qui n√©cessitent l'information dans ce format.

Pour choisir le bon outil, je te conseille de chercher des options sp√©cifiquement con√ßues pour les petites organisations ou les non-profits, car elles seront probablement plus adapt√©es √† tes besoins et √† ton budget.

Et n'oublie pas, m√™me si √ßa peut para√Ætre un peu complexe au d√©but, c'est une comp√©tence super utile √† ajouter √† ton arsenal d'expert en IT ! Et puis, √ßa te donne une bonne raison de plonger dans un nouveau projet, en restant focalis√© sur ce qui est important pour toi et ton organisation. üòâ

==> "je te conseille de chercher des options sp√©cifiquement con√ßues pour les petites organisations ou les non-profits, car elles seront probablement plus adapt√©es √† tes besoins et √† ton budget."

Pourrais-tu m'aider pour une fonction en VBA.
A la base j'appel cette fonction :
Function ExtractInfoAfterDescr(descStr As String) As String
    Dim startSearch As Integer
    Dim endSearch As Integer
    Dim extractedInfo As String
    ' Trouver le d√©but de la cha√Æne √† extraire
    startSearch = InStr(1, descStr, "PROPRE DESCR.")
    If startSearch > 0 Then
        ' Ajouter la longueur de "PROPRE DESCR." plus 4 (3 espaces et 1 ":")
        startSearch = startSearch + Len("PROPRE DESCR.") + 4
        ' Trouver la fin de la cha√Æne √† extraire
        endSearch = InStr(startSearch + 1, descStr, ":")
        ' Extraire la cha√Æne
        If endSearch > 0 Then
            extractedInfo = Trim(Mid(descStr, startSearch, endSearch - startSearch))
        Else
            ' Si aucun deuxi√®me ":" n'est trouv√©, prendre tout jusqu'√† la fin de la cha√Æne
            extractedInfo = Trim(Mid(descStr, startSearch))
        End If
    End If
    ExtractInfoAfterDescr = extractedInfo  ' Retourner le r√©sultat
End Function

Pour extraire ces informations :
OVH SAS	| PAYMENT ORDER 112999583
MICROSOFT PAYMENTS	| MICROSOFT .OFFICE 365
EDF LUMINUS	| 6.812.912/CSM 2022 312.533
De ces cha√Ænes de caract√®res :
DOMICILIATION EUROPEENNE             16-09 CREANCIER       : OVH SAS REF. CREANCIER  : BM267275-OVH, ORDER 112999583 REFERENCE MANDAT: BM267275-OVH-FR-2 COMMUNICATION   : PAYMENT ORDER 112999583
DOMICILIATION EUROPEENNE             27-03 CREANCIER       : MICROSOFT PAYMENTS REF. CREANCIER  : Z30R9QCVA8DW REFERENCE MANDAT: MS00000035GTGR8002 COMMUNICATION   : MICROSOFT .OFFICE 365
DOMICILIATION EUROPEENNE             03-10 CREANCIER       : EDF LUMINUS NV REF. CREANCIER  : D2022000682/60 REFERENCE MANDAT: 9000209407289 COMMUNICATION   : 6.812.912/CSM 2022 312.533

Mais je pense que la fonction ne convient pas du tout.
Pourrais-tu √©crire une version qui fonctionnerait stp ?

Pour extraire les informations sp√©cifiques de ces cha√Ænes de caract√®res, nous devons ajuster votre fonction VBA pour qu'elle recherche le bon motif. Dans votre cas, il semble que vous souhaitiez extraire la partie de la cha√Æne de caract√®res qui suit imm√©diatement le terme "COMMUNICATION :".

Voici une version modifi√©e de votre fonction qui devrait faire cela :

```vba
Function ExtractInfoAfterDescr(descStr As String) As String
    Dim startSearch As Integer
    Dim extractedInfo As String

    ' Trouver le d√©but de la cha√Æne √† extraire apr√®s "COMMUNICATION   : "
    startSearch = InStr(1, descStr, "COMMUNICATION   : ")
    If startSearch > 0 Then
        ' Ajouter la longueur de "COMMUNICATION   : " pour commencer apr√®s ce texte
        startSearch = startSearch + Len("COMMUNICATION   : ")
        
        ' Extraire la cha√Æne √† partir de ce point jusqu'√† la fin
        extractedInfo = Trim(Mid(descStr, startSearch))
    Else
        ' Si "COMMUNICATION   : " n'est pas trouv√©, retourner une cha√Æne vide
        extractedInfo = ""
    End If
    
    ExtractInfoAfterDescr = extractedInfo  ' Retourner le r√©sultat
End Function
```

Cette fonction cherche le d√©but de la cha√Æne de caract√®res apr√®s "COMMUNICATION   : " et extrait tout ce qui suit jusqu'√† la fin de la cha√Æne. Nous n'avons pas besoin de chercher un second ":", car votre objectif est d'obtenir le reste de la cha√Æne apr√®s "COMMUNICATION   : ".

Pour utiliser cette fonction dans Excel, vous pouvez l'appeler en passant la cha√Æne de caract√®res compl√®te en tant que `descStr`, et elle devrait retourner la partie que vous souhaitez.

Assurez-vous d'ajuster la fonction en fonction des espaces exacts apr√®s "COMMUNICATION" dans vos donn√©es r√©elles, car la fonction `InStr` est sensible aux espaces.
Et avant de tester il me semble que tu as oubli√© de consid√®rer l'exctraction du creancier ?!

Vous avez raison. Si vous voulez √©galement extraire le nom du cr√©ancier, nous devons adapter la fonction pour qu'elle recherche d'abord le nom du cr√©ancier apr√®s "CR√âANCIER       :", et ensuite la partie apr√®s "COMMUNICATION   :" pour le descriptif de la communication.

Nous allons donc avoir deux parties √† extraire : le cr√©ancier et la communication. Voici une version de la fonction qui effectue les deux extractions :

```vba
Function ExtractInfoAfterDescr(descStr As String) As String
    Dim startSearchCred As Integer
    Dim endSearchCred As Integer
    Dim startSearchComm As Integer
    Dim extractedCred As String
    Dim extractedComm As String

    ' Trouver le d√©but et la fin du cr√©ancier
    startSearchCred = InStr(1, descStr, "CREANCIER       : ")
    endSearchCred = InStr(startSearchCred, descStr, "REF.")

    If startSearchCred > 0 And endSearchCred > 0 Then
        ' Extraire le nom du cr√©ancier
        startSearchCred = startSearchCred + Len("CREANCIER       : ")
        extractedCred = Trim(Mid(descStr, startSearchCred, endSearchCred - startSearchCred))
    End If

    ' Trouver le d√©but de la cha√Æne √† extraire apr√®s "COMMUNICATION   : "
    startSearchComm = InStr(1, descStr, "COMMUNICATION   : ")
    If startSearchComm > 0 Then
        ' Ajouter la longueur de "COMMUNICATION   : " pour commencer apr√®s ce texte
        startSearchComm = startSearchComm + Len("COMMUNICATION   : ")
        
        ' Extraire la cha√Æne de communication √† partir de ce point jusqu'√† la fin
        extractedComm = Trim(Mid(descStr, startSearchComm))
    End If

    ' Concat√©ner le cr√©ancier et la communication
    If Len(extractedCred) > 0 And Len(extractedComm) > 0 Then
        ExtractInfoAfterDescr = extractedCred & " | " & extractedComm
    ElseIf Len(extractedCred) > 0 Then
        ExtractInfoAfterDescr = extractedCred
    ElseIf Len(extractedComm) > 0 Then
        ExtractInfoAfterDescr = extractedComm
    Else
        ExtractInfoAfterDescr = ""
    End If
End Function
```

Cette fonction renverra une cha√Æne format√©e avec le nom du cr√©ancier suivi de la communication, s√©par√©s par " | ", ou juste l'un d'eux si l'autre n'est pas trouv√©. Assurez-vous de tester cette fonction avec vos donn√©es r√©elles pour confirmer qu'elle fonctionne comme pr√©vu, car les espaces exacts et le format peuvent varier.

C'est presque parfait mais je souhaiterai mettre le contenu extrait pour CREANCIER dans la colonne "Cr√©ancier/D√©biteur" et le contenu de COMMUNICATION dans la colonne "Communication".
Pourrais-tu adapter la fin stp ?

Bien s√ªr, il semble que vous souhaitiez diviser la fonction en deux parties distinctes pour s√©parer les valeurs dans deux colonnes diff√©rentes dans Excel. Vous pouvez cr√©er deux fonctions distinctes pour cela : une pour extraire le cr√©ancier et l'autre pour la communication. Voici comment vous pourriez structurer ces fonctions :

```vba
Function ExtractCreditor(descStr As String) As String
    Dim startSearch As Integer
    Dim endSearch As Integer
    Dim extractedCred As String
    
    ' Trouver le d√©but et la fin du cr√©ancier
    startSearch = InStr(1, descStr, "CREANCIER       : ")
    If startSearch > 0 Then
        startSearch = startSearch + Len("CREANCIER       : ")
        endSearch = InStr(startSearch, descStr, "REF.")
        If endSearch > 0 Then
            extractedCred = Trim(Mid(descStr, startSearch, endSearch - startSearch))
        Else
            extractedCred = Trim(Mid(descStr, startSearch))
        End If
    End If
    
    ExtractCreditor = extractedCred
End Function

Function ExtractCommunication(descStr As String) As String
    Dim startSearch As Integer
    Dim extractedComm As String
    
    ' Trouver le d√©but de la cha√Æne √† extraire apr√®s "COMMUNICATION   : "
    startSearch = InStr(1, descStr, "COMMUNICATION   : ")
    If startSearch > 0 Then
        startSearch = startSearch + Len("COMMUNICATION   : ")
        extractedComm = Trim(Mid(descStr, startSearch))
    End If
    
    ExtractCommunication = extractedComm
End Function
```

Avec ces deux fonctions, vous pouvez appeler `ExtractCreditor` pour remplir la colonne "Cr√©ancier/D√©biteur" et `ExtractCommunication` pour remplir la colonne "Communication". Vous pouvez utiliser ces fonctions dans les cellules de votre feuille Excel de la mani√®re suivante :

Pour extraire le cr√©ancier, entrez dans la cellule de la colonne "Cr√©ancier/D√©biteur" :
```excel
=ExtractCreditor(A1)
```

Et pour extraire la communication, entrez dans la cellule de la colonne "Communication" :
```excel
=ExtractCommunication(A1)
```

Assurez-vous de remplacer `A1` par la r√©f√©rence de cellule qui contient la cha√Æne de caract√®res compl√®te d'o√π vous souhaitez extraire les informations.

Pourquoi diviser en 2 fonctions ?
Je pr√©f√®rerai garder √ßa en une fonction car cette fonction est d√©j√† une sous fonction appell√©e. J'ai peur de cr√©er trop de sous fonctions.

D'accord, nous pouvons garder une seule fonction qui renverra les deux parties d'information, mais nous devons alors retourner un type de donn√©es qui peut contenir deux valeurs distinctes. En VBA, nous pouvons le faire en utilisant un tableau ou un objet de type `Collection` ou `Dictionary`.

Dans ce cas, je sugg√®re d'utiliser un tableau pour sa simplicit√©. Voici comment vous pouvez modifier la fonction pour retourner un tableau avec deux √©l√©ments : le cr√©ancier et la communication.

```vba
Function ExtractInfo(descStr As String) As String()
    Dim startSearch As Integer
    Dim endSearch As Integer
    Dim extractedInfo(1) As String ' Tableau pour contenir le cr√©ancier et la communication
    
    ' Trouver le d√©but et la fin du cr√©ancier
    startSearch = InStr(1, descStr, "CREANCIER       : ")
    If startSearch > 0 Then
        startSearch = startSearch + Len("CREANCIER       : ")
        endSearch = InStr(startSearch, descStr, "REF.")
        If endSearch > 0 Then
            extractedInfo(0) = Trim(Mid(descStr, startSearch, endSearch - startSearch))
        Else
            extractedInfo(0) = Trim(Mid(descStr, startSearch))
        End If
    End If
    
    ' Trouver le d√©but de la cha√Æne √† extraire apr√®s "COMMUNICATION   : "
    startSearch = InStr(1, descStr, "COMMUNICATION   : ")
    If startSearch > 0 Then
        startSearch = startSearch + Len("COMMUNICATION   : ")
        extractedInfo(1) = Trim(Mid(descStr, startSearch))
    End If
    
    ExtractInfo = extractedInfo ' Retourner le tableau
End Function
```

Avec cette fonction, lorsque vous l'appelerez, elle renverra un tableau de deux √©l√©ments. Vous pouvez ensuite utiliser cette fonction dans Excel de cette fa√ßon :

Pour la cellule dans la colonne "Cr√©ancier/D√©biteur" :
```excel
=Index(ExtractInfo(A1), 1)
```

Pour la cellule dans la colonne "Communication" :
```excel
=Index(ExtractInfo(A1), 2)
```

Cela suppose que la cha√Æne de caract√®res √† analyser se trouve dans la cellule `A1`. La fonction `Index` est utilis√©e pour s√©lectionner l'√©l√©ment du tableau √† retourner dans chaque cellule.

Alors le probl√®me est que je devrais avoir les 2 infos.
Regarde la fonction "m√®re" qui appel ExtractInfoAfterDescr.
C'est celle ci :
Sub ExtractInfo_DEF()
    Dim ws As Worksheet
    Dim firstRow As Long, lastRow As Long, i As Long
    Dim descStr As String, extractedInfo As String
    Dim pos As Integer, firstSpacePos As Integer, secondSpacePos As Integer
    Dim operationType As String, cardNum As String
    Dim firstCol As Integer  ' <-- ajout√© ici

Voici la fonction `ExtractInfoAfterDescr` modifi√©e qui renvoie un tableau avec le cr√©ancier et la communication :

```vba
Function ExtractInfoAfterDescr(descStr As String) As Variant
    Dim startSearchCred As Integer
    Dim endSearchCred As Integer
    Dim startSearchComm As Integer
    Dim extractedCred As String
    Dim extractedComm As String
    Dim results(1) As String
    
    ' Extraire le cr√©ancier
    startSearchCred = InStr(1, descStr, "CREANCIER       : ")
    If startSearchCred > 0 Then
        startSearchCred = startSearchCred + Len("CREANCIER       : ")
        endSearchCred = InStr(startSearchCred, descStr, "REF.")
        If endSearchCred > startSearchCred Then
            extractedCred = Mid(descStr, startSearchCred, endSearchCred - startSearchCred)
        Else
            extractedCred = Mid(descStr, startSearchCred)
        End If
        extractedCred = Trim(extractedCred)
    End If
    
    ' Extraire la communication
    startSearchComm = InStr(1, descStr, "COMMUNICATION   : ")
    If startSearchComm > 0 Then
        startSearchComm = startSearchComm + Len("COMMUNICATION   : ")
        extractedComm = Mid(descStr, startSearchComm)
        extractedComm = Trim(extractedComm)
    End If
    
    ' Assigner les r√©sultats au tableau
    results(0) = extractedCred
    results(1) = extractedComm
    
    ExtractInfoAfterDescr = results
End Function
```

```vba
Sub ExtractInfo_DEF()
    Dim ws As Worksheet
    Dim firstRow As Long, lastRow As Long, i As Long
    Dim descStr As String
    Dim operationType As String
    Dim extractedInfo(1) As String ' Tableau pour contenir le cr√©ancier et la communication pour chaque cas
    Dim headerRow As Long
    
    ' D√©finir la feuille de travail
    Set ws = ActiveSheet
    
    ' D√©finir la ligne contenant les en-t√™tes de colonne
    headerRow = 1 ' Ajustez ce num√©ro si vos en-t√™tes sont sur une autre ligne
    
    ' Trouver les indices des colonnes par nom d'en-t√™te
    Dim colIndexCreditor As Integer
    Dim colIndexCommunication As Integer
    colIndexCreditor = 0
    colIndexCommunication = 0
    Dim cell As Range
    For Each cell In ws.Rows(headerRow).Cells
        If cell.Value = "Cr√©ancier/D√©biteur" Then
            colIndexCreditor = cell.Column
        ElseIf cell.Value = "Communication" Then
            colIndexCommunication = cell.Column
        End If
    Next cell
    
    ' Si on ne trouve pas les en-t√™tes, afficher un message et sortir de la Sub
    If colIndexCreditor = 0 Or colIndexCommunication = 0 Then
        MsgBox "L'un des en-t√™tes 'Cr√©ancier/D√©biteur' ou 'Communication' n'a pas √©t√© trouv√©."
        Exit Sub
    End If

    lastRow = firstRow + Selection.Rows.Count - 1

        descStr = ws.Cells(i, Selection.Column).Value

        ' R√©initialiser extractedInfo pour chaque ligne
        extractedInfo(0) = ""
        extractedInfo(1) = ""
        
        ' Selon le type d'op√©ration, extraire les informations requises
        Select Case operationType
            ' ***** DOMICILIATION EUROPEENNE ******
            Case "DOMICILIATION EUROPEENNE"
                Dim temp As Variant
                temp = ExtractInfoAfterDescr(descStr)
                extractedInfo(0) = temp(0) ' Cr√©ancier/D√©biteur
                extractedInfo(1) = temp(1) ' Communication
                
            ' ***** Autres cas ******

            Case Else
                ' Si le type d'op√©ration ne correspond √† aucun cas, utiliser un slash (/)
                extractedInfo(0) = "/"
                extractedInfo(1) = "/"
        End Select
        
        ' Assigner les valeurs extraites aux colonnes appropri√©es
        ws.Cells(i, colIndexCreditor).Value = extractedInfo(0)
```

# Q&A: How do I disable the sound on the Facebook ‚ÄòLike‚Äô button?

Posted on September 2, 2021

3.1k 

SHARES

„Äê8‚Ä†Share‚Ä†www.facebook.com„Äë„Äê9‚Ä†Tweet‚Ä†twitter.com„ÄëSubscribe

[Image 0]„Äê5‚Ä†Click here„Äë to sign up for my free Rick‚Äôs Tech Tips Newsletter!

* * *

Question from Eloise:¬† I recently started using the Facebook app on my phone and there‚Äôs something that‚Äôs really bugging me.

Every time I ‚ÄúLike‚Äù something it makes an annoying popping sound and it‚Äôs driving me bonkers.

Surely there‚Äôs some way to stop it from making that sound. Can you tell me how to do it?

Rick‚Äôs answer:¬† I agree with you, Eloise. That really is an annoying sound, especially if you‚Äôre in a place like a library where making distracting sounds is discouraged.

Luckily, it‚Äôs very easy to turn off the sound the ‚ÄúLike‚Äù button makes when you tap it. Just follow the steps below.

Note: Depending on the version of the Facebook app that‚Äôs on your device, the steps in this procedure could vary just a bit. Therefore you should use this as a general guide.

1 ‚Äì Open the Facebook app and sign in to your account.

2 ‚Äì Tape the Menu icon in the top-right corner of the screen (it looks like three horizontal lines).

3 ‚Äì Tap Settings & Privacy.

4 ‚Äì Tap Settings.

5 ‚Äì Scroll down and tap Media (on some devices this is listed as Media and contacts).

6 ‚Äì Scroll down and toggle the ‚ÄúSounds in the app‚Äù setting to Off.

Prefer following visual instructions? Watch this short video:

Ôªø  

That‚Äôs all there is to it. You should no longer hear that annoying popping noise every time you ‚ÄúLike‚Äù something on Facebook.

I hope this helps, Eloise. Good luck!

# Q&A: How do I disable the sound on the Facebook ‚ÄòLike‚Äô button?

Posted on September 2, 2021

3.1k 

SHARES

„Äê8‚Ä†Share‚Ä†www.facebook.com„Äë„Äê9‚Ä†Tweet‚Ä†twitter.com„ÄëSubscribe

[Image 0]„Äê5‚Ä†Click here„Äë to sign up for my free Rick‚Äôs Tech Tips Newsletter!

* * *

Question from Eloise:¬† I recently started using the Facebook app on my phone and there‚Äôs something that‚Äôs really bugging me.

Every time I ‚ÄúLike‚Äù something it makes an annoying popping sound and it‚Äôs driving me bonkers.

Surely there‚Äôs some way to stop it from making that sound. Can you tell me how to do it?

Rick‚Äôs answer:¬† I agree with you, Eloise. That really is an annoying sound, especially if you‚Äôre in a place like a library where making distracting sounds is discouraged.

Luckily, it‚Äôs very easy to turn off the sound the ‚ÄúLike‚Äù button makes when you tap it. Just follow the steps below.

Note: Depending on the version of the Facebook app that‚Äôs on your device, the steps in this procedure could vary just a bit. Therefore you should use this as a general guide.

1 ‚Äì Open the Facebook app and sign in to your account.

2 ‚Äì Tape the Menu icon in the top-right corner of the screen (it looks like three horizontal lines).

3 ‚Äì Tap Settings & Privacy.

4 ‚Äì Tap Settings.

5 ‚Äì Scroll down and tap Media (on some devices this is listed as Media and contacts).

6 ‚Äì Scroll down and toggle the ‚ÄúSounds in the app‚Äù setting to Off.

Prefer following visual instructions? Watch this short video:

Ôªø  

That‚Äôs all there is to it. You should no longer hear that annoying popping noise every time you ‚ÄúLike‚Äù something on Facebook.

I hope this helps, Eloise. Good luck!

Update from Eloise:¬† Thank you, thank you, thank you!!!

„Äê109‚Ä†Home„Äë ¬ª „Äê108‚Ä†Blog„Äë ¬ª How to Turn off Facebook Sounds

# How to Turn off Facebook Sounds to Have the Best Social Media Experience

[Image 0: Megan Green][Image 1: Megan Green]

Megan Green

February 25, 2021

Share:

  * „Äê112‚Ä† ‚Ä†t.me„Äë 
  * „Äê113‚Ä† ‚Ä†www.facebook.com„Äë 
  * „Äê114‚Ä† ‚Ä†twitter.com„Äë 
  * „Äê115‚Ä† ‚Ä†pinterest.com„Äë 

Love it or hate it, social media is one of the leading ways to stay in touch with friends and family. But it seems like Facebook and „Äê116‚Ä†other social media„Äë companies keep implementing new app changes that are in no way improvements.

For instance, Facebook‚Äôs iPhone and Android apps have become absurdly noisy. Luckily, there is a simple way to learn how to turn off FB sounds.

* * *

## Table of Contents

  1. „Äê117‚Ä†Disable In-App Sounds„Äë
  2. „Äê118‚Ä†Switch Off Video Auto-Play„Äë
  3. „Äê119‚Ä†Why is Facebook Making So Much Noise?„Äë
  4. „Äê120‚Ä†How Do I Activate Sounds on Facebook?„Äë

## Turn off Facebook Sounds Once and For All

[Image 2: Turn off Facebook Sounds][Image 3: Turn off Facebook Sounds]

There are so many random noises in the 2023 version of the „Äê15‚Ä†Facebook app„Äë that it feels like some kind of prank by the developers. There are sounds for post notifications, refreshing the news feed, and other random events like a person typing in the messenger. The best (or worst, really) is the loud auto-playing videos throughout the feed.

The good news is, the app includes a way to silence the noise. No matter the operating system in question, here are the best solutions to turn off Facebook sounds.

### Shut Off App Sounds on Facebook for iPhone

When it comes to silencing the carnival of noises on Facebook, there is a straightforward way to adjust settings to get the job done.

For the iPhone, this adjustment can be made in only five steps.¬†

  1. With the app open, locate and select the three lines on the bottom, right-hand corner of the screen.
  2. Look through the options and find ‚ÄòPrivacy & Settings.‚Äô
  3. Tap to drop-down the list, then select ‚ÄòSettings.‚Äô
  4. Scroll down to the ‚ÄòSounds‚Äô option. Click it.
  5. Find ‚ÄòIn-App Sounds‚Äô and toggle the button to ‚Äòoff.‚Äô

### Shut Off App Noises on Facebook for Android

Though it doesn‚Äôt make any sense, silence the Facebook app on the Android operating system is not the same as IOS.

In fact, turning off Facebook sounds on Android requires taking a new path through the device settings. Luckily, the best method is still nice and short.

  1. With Facebook open, tap on the three lines located at the top of the screen.
  2. Search for ‚ÄòPrivacy & Settings.‚Äô
  3. Select it, then tap on ‚ÄòSettings.‚Äô
  4. Locate the ‚ÄòMedia and Contacts‚Äô option and press it.
  5. Locate the ‚Äòsounds in the app‚Äô setting and press the button to switch it off.

## Disable Sound on Facebook Videos and Scroll the News Feed in Peace

[Image 4: Disable Sound on Facebook Videos][Image 5: Disable Sound on Facebook Videos]

The standard noises on devices using the app are annoying enough as is. Add in loud, auto-play videos, and Facebook has users running for Twitter and other social media out of frustration.

That‚Äôs right; the newest versions of the app have somehow managed to become even louder. While older versions of the iPhone and Android apps required users to tap on videos for sound, the 2023 edition of Facebook is all about blaring as much noise as possible at all times.

Mercifully, it isn‚Äôt too difficult to disable auto-play on Facebook videos.

### Disable Video Sounds on Facebook for IOS

To deactivate auto-playing videos on iPhone, users must be logged into their accounts and on the home screen.

From there, the process as follows:

  1. Locate the three lines on the bottom right of the screen and tap them.
  2. Scroll to ‚ÄòSettings‚Äô and select it.
  3. From there, choose the account settings button.
  4. Tap ‚ÄòSounds.‚Äô
  5. Switch the button to ‚Äòoff‚Äô for ‚ÄúVideos in News Feed Start with Sound.‚Äù

### Disable Video Auto-Play on Facebook for Android

Surprisingly, turning off sounds in Facebook app for Android is even simpler than the IOS¬† 2023 version. Start by opening Facebook and ensuring it is logged in.

Once on the home screen, follow these four steps:

  1. Find and tap the three lines on the top, right corner of the screen.
  2. Find and select ‚ÄúApp Settings.‚Äù
  3. Locate the option that reads, ‚ÄúVideos in News Feed Start with Sound.‚Äù
  4. Toggle the switch to ‚Äòoff.‚Äô

## Frequently Asked Questions

### Why is Facebook Making So Much Noise?

With the popularity of social media endlessly on the rise, companies like Facebook are constantly looking for ways to keep their audience‚Äôs attention. Though there are a lot of methods available to these developers, Facebook seems to be focusing on audio-haptic feedback, which isn‚Äôt the best policy.

Audio-haptic is a mix of stimuli that includes both audio and touch. An example is hearing a jingle when a message appears in conjunction with a pulse or vibration.

This type of feedback is thought to make users want to interact with the application more, though many users argue the overbearing stimuli are actually driving them away.

### How Do I Activate Sounds on Facebook?

The 2023 version of Facebook typically has sound settings automatically enabled, which is why so many people want to turn off Facebook sounds. However, users who aren‚Äôt hearing any noises can resolve the issue through the Privacy and Settings menu.

Here are the easy steps:

  1. Finding the three-lined menu button either on the bottom or top-right of the screen.
  2. Scroll to ‚ÄòPrivacy & Settings.‚Äù Select it and tap on ‚ÄòSettings.‚Äô
  3. Search for the ‚ÄòSounds‚Äô menu (IOS) or ‚ÄòMedia and Contacts‚Äô menu (Android).
  4. Find the ‚ÄòSounds in App‚Äô option and toggle the switch to ‚Äòon.‚Äô

## Get Back to Enjoying Social Media

Social media can be a great way to learn new information and stay in touch with old friends. If users follow the platform‚Äôs policy standards and adjust their privacy settings, it can be a safe and fun way to waste some time. However, Facebook‚Äôs absurd circus of sounds can make using the platform a bit of a headache. Knowing how to quiet down the app is the best step to customizing it to be a much more enjoyable digital tool.

Do you think the Facebook app is way too noisy? What are your best tips for making Facebook better? Let us know in the comments below.

There are so many random noises in the 2023 version of the „Äê15‚Ä†Facebook app„Äë that it feels like some kind of prank by the developers. There are sounds for post notifications, refreshing the news feed, and other random events like a person typing in the messenger. The best (or worst, really) is the loud auto-playing videos throughout the feed.

The good news is, the app includes a way to silence the noise. No matter the operating system in question, here are the best solutions to turn off Facebook sounds.

### Shut Off App Sounds on Facebook for iPhone

When it comes to silencing the carnival of noises on Facebook, there is a straightforward way to adjust settings to get the job done.

For the iPhone, this adjustment can be made in only five steps.¬†

  1. With the app open, locate and select the three lines on the bottom, right-hand corner of the screen.
  2. Look through the options and find ‚ÄòPrivacy & Settings.‚Äô
  3. Tap to drop-down the list, then select ‚ÄòSettings.‚Äô

### Shut Off App Noises on Facebook for Android

Though it doesn‚Äôt make any sense, silence the Facebook app on the Android operating system is not the same as IOS.

In fact, turning off Facebook sounds on Android requires taking a new path through the device settings. Luckily, the best method is still nice and short.

  1. With Facebook open, tap on the three lines located at the top of the screen.
  2. Search for ‚ÄòPrivacy & Settings.‚Äô
  3. Select it, then tap on ‚ÄòSettings.‚Äô
  4. Locate the ‚ÄòMedia and Contacts‚Äô option and press it.
  5. Locate the ‚Äòsounds in the app‚Äô setting and press the button to switch it off.

## Disable Sound on Facebook Videos and Scroll the News Feed in Peace

To deactivate auto-playing videos on iPhone, users must be logged into their accounts and on the home screen.

### Why is Facebook Making So Much Noise?

With the popularity of social media endlessly on the rise, companies like Facebook are constantly looking for ways to keep their audience‚Äôs attention. Though there are a lot of methods available to these developers, Facebook seems to be focusing on audio-haptic feedback, which isn‚Äôt the best policy.

Audio-haptic is a mix of stimuli that includes both audio and touch. An example is hearing a jingle when a message appears in conjunction with a pulse or vibration.

This type of feedback is thought to make users want to interact with the application more, though many users argue the overbearing stimuli are actually driving them away.

# How to Turn off Facebook Sounds to Have the Best Social Media Experience

[Image 0: Megan Green][Image 1: Megan Green]

Megan Green

February 25, 2021

Share:

  * „Äê112‚Ä† ‚Ä†t.me„Äë 
  * „Äê113‚Ä† ‚Ä†www.facebook.com„Äë 
  * „Äê114‚Ä† ‚Ä†twitter.com„Äë 
  * „Äê115‚Ä† ‚Ä†pinterest.com„Äë 

Love it or hate it, social media is one of the leading ways to stay in touch with friends and family. But it seems like Facebook and „Äê116‚Ä†other social media„Äë companies keep implementing new app changes that are in no way improvements.

For instance, Facebook‚Äôs iPhone and Android apps have become absurdly noisy. Luckily, there is a simple way to learn how to turn off FB sounds.

* * *

## Table of Contents

  1. „Äê117‚Ä†Disable In-App Sounds„Äë
  2. „Äê118‚Ä†Switch Off Video Auto-Play„Äë
  3. „Äê119‚Ä†Why is Facebook Making So Much Noise?„Äë
  4. „Äê120‚Ä†How Do I Activate Sounds on Facebook?„Äë

## Turn off Facebook Sounds Once and For All

[Image 2: Turn off Facebook Sounds][Image 3: Turn off Facebook Sounds]

There are so many random noises in the 2023 version of the „Äê15‚Ä†Facebook app„Äë that it feels like some kind of prank by the developers. There are sounds for post notifications, refreshing the news feed, and other random events like a person typing in the messenger. The best (or worst, really) is the loud auto-playing videos throughout the feed.

The good news is, the app includes a way to silence the noise. No matter the operating system in question, here are the best solutions to turn off Facebook sounds.

### Shut Off App Sounds on Facebook for iPhone

When it comes to silencing the carnival of noises on Facebook, there is a straightforward way to adjust settings to get the job done.

For the iPhone, this adjustment can be made in only five steps.¬†

  1. With the app open, locate and select the three lines on the bottom, right-hand corner of the screen.
  2. Look through the options and find ‚ÄòPrivacy & Settings.‚Äô
  3. Tap to drop-down the list, then select ‚ÄòSettings.‚Äô
  4. Scroll down to the ‚ÄòSounds‚Äô option. Click it.
  5. Find ‚ÄòIn-App Sounds‚Äô and toggle the button to ‚Äòoff.‚Äô

### Shut Off App Noises on Facebook for Android

Though it doesn‚Äôt make any sense, silence the Facebook app on the Android operating system is not the same as IOS.

In fact, turning off Facebook sounds on Android requires taking a new path through the device settings. Luckily, the best method is still nice and short.

  1. With Facebook open, tap on the three lines located at the top of the screen.
  2. Search for ‚ÄòPrivacy & Settings.‚Äô
  3. Select it, then tap on ‚ÄòSettings.‚Äô
  4. Locate the ‚ÄòMedia and Contacts‚Äô option and press it.
  5. Locate the ‚Äòsounds in the app‚Äô setting and press the button to switch it off.

## Disable Sound on Facebook Videos and Scroll the News Feed in Peace

[Image 4: Disable Sound on Facebook Videos][Image 5: Disable Sound on Facebook Videos]

The standard noises on devices using the app are annoying enough as is. Add in loud, auto-play videos, and Facebook has users running for Twitter and other social media out of frustration.

That‚Äôs right; the newest versions of the app have somehow managed to become even louder. While older versions of the iPhone and Android apps required users to tap on videos for sound, the 2023 edition of Facebook is all about blaring as much noise as possible at all times.

Mercifully, it isn‚Äôt too difficult to disable auto-play on Facebook videos.

### Disable Video Sounds on Facebook for IOS

To deactivate auto-playing videos on iPhone, users must be logged into their accounts and on the home screen.

From there, the process as follows:

  1. Locate the three lines on the bottom right of the screen and tap them.
  2. Scroll to ‚ÄòSettings‚Äô and select it.
  3. From there, choose the account settings button.
  4. Tap ‚ÄòSounds.‚Äô
  5. Switch the button to ‚Äòoff‚Äô for ‚ÄúVideos in News Feed Start with Sound.‚Äù

### Disable Video Auto-Play on Facebook for Android

Surprisingly, turning off sounds in Facebook app for Android is even simpler than the IOS¬† 2023 version. Start by opening Facebook and ensuring it is logged in.

Once on the home screen, follow these four steps:

  1. Find and tap the three lines on the top, right corner of the screen.
  2. Find and select ‚ÄúApp Settings.‚Äù
  3. Locate the option that reads, ‚ÄúVideos in News Feed Start with Sound.‚Äù
  4. Toggle the switch to ‚Äòoff.‚Äô

## Frequently Asked Questions

### Why is Facebook Making So Much Noise?

With the popularity of social media endlessly on the rise, companies like Facebook are constantly looking for ways to keep their audience‚Äôs attention. Though there are a lot of methods available to these developers, Facebook seems to be focusing on audio-haptic feedback, which isn‚Äôt the best policy.

Audio-haptic is a mix of stimuli that includes both audio and touch. An example is hearing a jingle when a message appears in conjunction with a pulse or vibration.

This type of feedback is thought to make users want to interact with the application more, though many users argue the overbearing stimuli are actually driving them away.

### How Do I Activate Sounds on Facebook?

The 2023 version of Facebook typically has sound settings automatically enabled, which is why so many people want to turn off Facebook sounds. However, users who aren‚Äôt hearing any noises can resolve the issue through the Privacy and Settings menu.

Here are the easy steps:

  1. Finding the three-lined menu button either on the bottom or top-right of the screen.
  2. Scroll to ‚ÄòPrivacy & Settings.‚Äù Select it and tap on ‚ÄòSettings.‚Äô
  3. Search for the ‚ÄòSounds‚Äô menu (IOS) or ‚ÄòMedia and Contacts‚Äô menu (Android).
  4. Find the ‚ÄòSounds in App‚Äô option and toggle the switch to ‚Äòon.‚Äô

## Get Back to Enjoying Social Media

Social media can be a great way to learn new information and stay in touch with old friends. If users follow the platform‚Äôs policy standards and adjust their privacy settings, it can be a safe and fun way to waste some time. However, Facebook‚Äôs absurd circus of sounds can make using the platform a bit of a headache. Knowing how to quiet down the app is the best step to customizing it to be a much more enjoyable digital tool.

Do you think the Facebook app is way too noisy? What are your best tips for making Facebook better? Let us know in the comments below.
